CatDescriptText: Mrs. Vivian Pegues, 502 Armandale Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 30, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that Negroes make full use of their voting franchise by registering and voting in both the primary and the general election?"  Answer reads: "Yes, I really believe that they do. They really come out to our polls in our neighborhood."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Vivian Pegues wearing graphic print dress with bow ties down bodice, standing on sidewalk with pedestrians and storefronts in background, including Rhea's... Nutty Nut Stores
